<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of producer_thread:
```c
static void *producer_thread(void *arg)
{
	(void)arg;
	metal_mutex_acquire(&lock);
	while (counter == COUNTER_MAX)
		metal_condition_wait(&nfull_condv, &lock);
	counter++;
	metal_condition_signal(&nempty_condv);
	metal_mutex_release(&lock);

	return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function producer_thread:
int metal_condition_wait(struct metal_condition *cv,
				       metal_mutex_t *m)
{
	uintptr_t tmpmptr = 0, mptr = (uintptr_t)m;
	int v = 0;

	/* Check if the mutex has been acquired */
	if (!cv || !m || !metal_mutex_is_acquired(m))
		return -EINVAL;

	if (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&cv->mptr, &tmpmptr, mptr)) {
		if (tmpmptr != mptr)
			return -EINVAL;
	}

	v = atomic_load(&cv->wakeups);
	atomic_fetch_add(&cv->waiters, 1);

	/* Release the mutex before sleeping. */
	metal_mutex_release(m);
	syscall(SYS_futex, &cv->wakeups, FUTEX_WAIT, v, NULL, NULL, 0);
	atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
	/* Acquire the mutex after it's waken up. */
	metal_mutex_acquire(m);

	return 0;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1) is a standard atomic operation (compiler intrinsic or library function) and does not call producer_thread. The call chain is producer_thread -> metal_condition_wait -> atomic_fetch_sub/atomic_fetch_add and other mutex/syscall functions; none of these call back into producer_thread, so there is no direct or indirect self-call.
